flawed_nl_solution:
The hay previously cost $15 per bale so 10 bales would cost $15*10 = $<<15*10=150>>150
Double 10 bales is 10*2 = <<10*2=20>>20 bales
Better quality hay cost $18 per bale so 20 bales would cost $18*20 = $<<18*20=630>>630
Farmer Brown would need $630-$150 = $<<630-150=480>>480 more
#### 480

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 360, not 630. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
